intro: Boronia fastigiata subsp. fastigiata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boronia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pink to white flowers during the autumn season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and heathland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
